website_summaries.verdict: For mobile users who travel within good Sprint 4G coverage areas--especially those traveling with laptops-- the Sprint MiFi 4082 3G/4G Mobile Hotspot makes a good companion.
pros: The Sprint MiFi 4082 3G/4G Mobile Hotspot is good looking, compact, easy to use, and features wireless N. The device comes with an affordable unlimited 4G data plan, includes GPS and network storage functionality, and has decent battery life
cons: The Sprint MiFi 4082 3G/4G Mobile Hotspot sporadically doesn't work well with certain Wi-Fi mobile devices and can support only five wireless clients at the most
The device runs hot at times and its 4G connection is comparatively slow

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on 4G
customer_reviews.text: This card worked great for me. I use it on trips with two iPads, cell phones and a laptop in my truck. All of them worked without lag. I checked the speed on speedtest.com while traveling and had 11mpbs download and 3mbps upload. Great! Would truly recommend this to everyone!

customer_reviews.title: Used for two years without problems
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure about the other reviews,and the problems that they were having with this device. I have been using it on both 3 and 4G on a net book, a laptop and a kindle fire. The speeds are good, and I am able to stream video without stalls. It is not as fast as my home wifi, but it is close enough. The battery is good enough to run for a couple of hours of streaming. You do have to turn it off to recharge it from USB.

customer_reviews.title: Will never trust SPRINT again
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these several years ago with "UNLIMITED" service. The device worked well but Sprint's lawyers decided that they did not like the Plain English definition of "unlimited". They stuck a low volume cap on the service reducing it to the point of being useless. Finally got my account terminated (after fighting with the Sprint customer reps for months) and I now have a very expensive paper weight.
